lead_paragraph: SCEcorp yesterday announced a reorganization aimed at preparing its Southern California Edison subsidiary -- the nation's second-largest electric company -- for state deregulation. Under the plan, the electric utility would be divided into five business units, as of Jan. 1. The announcement came less than two weeks after the Pacific Gas and Electric Company said that it would divide its power plants and power lines into separate units.

headline.main: UTILITY REORGANIZES TO PREPARE FOR DEREGULATION
